description: Perfect for the holidays or any chilly day, this hot white Russian dessert cocktail is cozy while still packing a bit of a punch and is a great adult alternative to hot cocoa.
ingredients: [{"name": "freshly brewed coffee", "units": "oz.", "amount": 4}, {"name": "Kahlúa", "units": "oz.", "amount": 2}, {"name": "whole milk", "units": "oz.", "amount": 2}, {"name": "vodka", "units": "oz.", "amount": 1}, {"name": "whipped cream", "units": null, "amount": null}]
instructions: In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine all ingredients and heat until warm (I recommend 150 to 155°F). Do not boil. Pour into mug(s) and serve immediately, topped with whipped cream, if desired.
notes: The recipe is written for one drink, with 1 part = ¼ cup. To double the recipe, use ½ cup as a part which will make three 6-ounce servings or two 9-ounce servings. Skim milk is not recommended for this recipe.
